word: Although you are fully aware of this,
parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To will, intend, desire, wish. Middle voice of a primary verb; to 'will, ' i.e. be willing.
To remind, remember, call to mind. From hupo and mimnesko; to remind quietly, i.e. Suggest to the memory.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
Second; with the article: in the second place, for the second time. As the compare of duo; second.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.
Apparently a primary word; a people.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and the base of olethros; to destroy fully, literally or figuratively.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
